function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of specific chemicals such as formaldehyde and acetaldehyde in the testing process can pose health risks to individuals.","Impact":"Exposure to formaldehyde and acetaldehyde can lead to respiratory issues and other health problems if not mitigated.","Mitigation":"Implement proper ventilation and use of protective equipment during testing to reduce exposure.","Technologies":"High-performance ventilation systems, personal protective equipment (PPE) for researchers.","People":"Researchers, laboratory staff, and individuals in the surrounding area.","Owner":"Laboratory management and research team."},{"Description":"Quasi-steady state assumption may lead to inaccurate estimation of emission rates, causing potential misinterpretation of data.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of emission rates can lead to incorrect conclusions about the level of air contamination in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Conduct regular validation of emission estimation methods and consider transient effects in the mass balance equation.","Technologies":"Real-time monitoring systems, accurate data logging and analysis software.","People":"Researchers, environmental engineers, and data analysts.","Owner":"Research team and environmental engineering department."},{"Description":"Neglecting the sink effect term in the mass balance equation may result in underestimation of contaminant levels, leading to inadequate mitigation measures.","Impact":"Underestimation of contaminant levels can result in insufficient ventilation and filtration measures, increasing health risks for occupants.","Mitigation":"Include the sink effect term in the mass balance equation and implement continuous monitoring of contaminant levels.","Technologies":"Continuous monitoring systems, advanced sensors for real-time data collection.","People":"Environmental engineers, facility managers, and building occupants.","Owner":"Environmental engineering department and facility management."}]}
